hi @rica an additional (time: 15mins) explain Zapier and Gravity Forms.

Hi Sophie, 

No sweat. As mentioned, it depends on how many ZAPS are fired. Here is their pricing page: https://zapier.com/pricing

It's free for less than 100/month. If you have all 2000 attendees submit the form, it takes you to a pro plan at $75/month.

Thanks for this Chris. I will arrange Zapier set up asap today - do you know what this may cost per month?

Sophie O'Neill

Senior Marketing Manager

P +61 2 8248 8000

Level 6, 143 Macquarie Street | Sydney NSW 2000, Australia

investmenttrends.com

(I work Monday, Tuesday, Thursday and Friday)

Hi Sophie, 

Gravity Forms allows the export to CSV but it's initiated manually. Please see the attached screenshot. 

If you would like each submission to populate a Google Sheet automatically, we have used and recommend https://zapier.com/. In short, it works as the link between Gravity Forms and Google Sheets. The price is determined by how many "zaps" or actions are performed. E.g. sending form submission data. 
The process would be to set up your account and share access with us. We'd need approximately an hour of support to set it up. 

If you wanted more visibility on how the 2000 users are progressing through your campaign, you are probably in CRM territory. https://www.pipedrive.com/ is a good example of managing leads is relatively simple and I am sure there are others.

Thanks Chris

Moving forward I think it will be important for us to have a lead gen opportunity that

- creates a csv spreadsheet for us.

-that can integrate with our Mailchimp list for example newsletter sign up.

Can you recommend a tool for this?

The below is for campaign for an event with 2000 attendees so fear the below will not be manageable /trackable.

If we have to invest in a new tool I am very open to having that conversation.

Look forward to hearing from you.

Best

Sophi

Sophie O'Neill

Senior Marketing Manager

P +61 2 8248 8000

Level 6, 143 Macquarie Street | Sydney NSW 2000, Australia

investmenttrends.com

(I work Monday, Tuesday, Thursday and Friday)

Hi Sophie,

The leads will appear as an email notification sent to emails: info@investmenttrends.com and s.oneill@investmenttrends.com. All submissions are also stored on the website for you to review as needed.

There isn't a spreadsheet feature in Gravity Forms. I am happy to chat through this if needed.

Tests can be completed by submitting the form at: https://investmenttrends.com/insightssession/. You should see a test submission from me in a few moments.
